concepts.name: The Coordinate Plane
concepts.description: A two-dimensional space defined by a horizontal axis (x-axis) and a vertical axis (y-axis), divided into four quadrants, used to graph equations and functions.

concepts.name: Identifying Coordinates
concepts.description: Finding the x and y values of a point on the coordinate plane, written as ordered pairs (x, y).

concepts.name: Plotting Points
concepts.description: Placing points on the coordinate plane based on their coordinates to visually represent data or relations.

concepts.name: Graphing Functions from Tables
concepts.description: Using a table of input-output pairs to plot points and create a graph representing a function.

concepts.name: Graphing Functions from Rules
concepts.description: Plotting a function using a given formula by calculating values for points and connecting them to form the graph.

concepts.name: Discrete and Continuous Functions
concepts.description: Understanding the distinction between functions defined for specific inputs (discrete) and those defined for all real numbers (continuous).

concepts.name: Graphs of Linear Equations
concepts.description: Representing linear relationships as straight lines on a graph, typically characterized by equations in slope-intercept form (y = mx + b).

concepts.name: Horizontal and Vertical Lines
concepts.description: Special linear graphs where horizontal lines have equations y = c and vertical lines have equations x = c, where c is a constant.

concepts.name: Finding Intercepts
concepts.description: Determining where a graph crosses the x-axis (x-intercept) and y-axis (y-intercept).

concepts.name: Slope and Rate of Change
concepts.description: Calculating the steepness of a line or the rate at which one variable changes relative to another using the formula m = (y2 - y1) / (x2 - x1).

concepts.name: Interpreting Graphs
concepts.description: Analyzing graphs to extract meaningful information, such as rates of change, intercepts, or trends in data.

concepts.name: Direct Variation
concepts.description: A relationship where one variable is directly proportional to another, represented by equations of the form y = kx.

concepts.name: Slope-Intercept Form
concepts.description: A way of writing linear equations as y = mx + b, where m is the slope and b is the y-intercept.

concepts.name: Problem-Solving with Graphs
concepts.description: Using graphs to model and solve real-world problems by interpreting relationships between variables.

concepts.name: Arithmetic Progressions and Linear Functions
concepts.description: Recognizing the connection between arithmetic sequences and the patterns in linear functions, which increase by a fixed amount each step.
